content.title: Atal Pension Yojana
content.details: Atal Pension Yojana (APY) is an old age income security scheme for a savings account holder in the age group of 18-40 years who is not an income tax-payee. The scheme helps in addressing the longevity risks among the workers in the unorganized sector and encourages the workers to voluntarily save for their retirement.
benefits: Guaranteed minimum pension amount of Rs. 1000/- to Rs. 5000/- per month after the age of 60 years until death.
Guaranteed minimum pension amount to the spouse after the subscriber’s demise.
Return of the pension wealth to the nominee after the demise of both the subscriber and the spouse.
eligibility: Minimum age of joining APY is 18 years and maximum is 40 years.
Subscribers must not be income tax payers.
Contributions must be made from the age of joining APY till the age of 60 years.
exclusions: Any citizen who is or has been an income tax payer, shall not be eligible to join APY.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. One can open an APY account online using net banking or visit the NSDL website for registration.
documents_required: KYC details fetched from active Bank/Post Office Savings account.

faqs.question: When will I receive my Pension?
faqs.answer: Age Of Start Of Pension is 60 Years.

faqs.question: Can I still apply for APY if I am a Swavalamban subscriber?
faqs.answer: Eligible Swavalamban Subscribers may be migrated to APY.

faqs.question: Is it required to furnish nomination while joining the scheme?
What will happen if the contribution gets delayed?
faqs.answer: Subscriber will be charged overdue interest for the delayed period.

faqs.question: Is Aadhaar Number compulsory for joining the scheme?
faqs.answer: It is not mandatory as of now.
